Coding:
Datasize can be max 50
One ID can be used for several rows (several cases), but is only connected to 1 person
Comment: Unique running number for each person

Coding:
Valid date yyyy-mm-dd
First possible date in JRC is 01.01.1870. There is no minimum allowed date in NORDCAN

0 = exact date of birth
1 = Set date of birth
Comment: Flagging of dates which are "set"/"made" because accurate/exact date is missing

"Current sex" is preferred in NORDCAN,
"Sex at time of diagnosis" or "sex at time of birth" can be used if "Current sex is not available.
"Sex at birth" is preferred by JRC/ENCR

Variable label/description: Regional place of residence at time of diagnosis
Code for geographical area of residence at diagnosis
Name of geographical area of residence at diagnosis

Coding:
Datasize can be max 50
Only one record for each running number is allowed in the raw data file.
Comment: Unique running number for each tumor

Variable label/description: Sequence of tumors for each person

Coding:
Valid date yyyy-mm-dd
Min allowed value: 01.01.1901
Max allowed value: according to user input (index year)
Comment:
Necessary for calculations of survival/days of follow up.
Will not be distributed out of the registries.
According to ICO 8601.
All registries have some issues with missing day and/or month for date of incidence. We include a variable for flagging of exact date.

Coding:
0 = exact date of incidence
1 = set date of incidence

Variable label/description: Basis of diagnosis according to ENCR recommendation
Coding:
0 = Death certificate only (DCO)
1 = Clinical
2 = Clinical investigation
4 = Specific tumor markers
5 = Cytology
6 = Histology of a metastasis
7 = Histology of a primary tumor
9 = Unknown
Comment:
Category 1/Clinical means clinical examination without any additional investigations.
Category 2/Clinical investigation includes blood samples, xray etc.
Non-valid values will be picked up by the IARCcrgCheckTool

Variable label/description: First 4 digits of morphology in ICDO3
Coding: Non-valid values will be picked up by the IARCcrgCheckTool

Comment:
0 = Benign neoplasm
1 = Neoplasm of uncertain and unknown behaviour (uncertain whether benign or malignant, “borderline” malignant, incipient cancer, bladder papilloma)
2 = In-situ neoplasm (carcinoma in situ/non invasive/preleukaemia/intraepithelial tumor)
3 = Malignant neoplasm

For solid tumours:
1 = Grade 1, Well differentiated
2 = Grade 2, Moderately differentiated
3 = Grade 3, Poorly differentiated
4 = Grade IV, Undifferentiated, anaplastic

For leukaemias and lymphomas (only for JRC):
5 = T-cell, T-precursor
6 = B-cell, Pre-B, B-precursor
7 = Null cell, Non T-non B
8 = NK-cell (natural killer cell)

For all:
9 = Unknown or not applicable

Coding:
0 = Not applicable
1 = Right
2 = Left
3 = Unilateral NOS
4 = Bilateral
9 = Unknown

Variable label/description: Incidental finding of cancer at autopsy
Coding:
0 = No (not found at autopsy)
1 = Yes (found at autopsy)
9 = Unknown

Variable label/description: Last known vital status of patient
Coding:
1 = Alive
2 = Dead
3 = Lost to follow up/Censored/Emigrated (NORDCAN only)
9 = Unknown

Variable label/description: Date for last known vital status
Coding:
Valid date yyyy-mm-dd
Min allowed value: 01.01.1901
Max allowed value: according to user input (index year)
Comment:
Necessary for calculations of survival/days of follow up.
Will not be distributed out of the registry.
Date of death or emigration if Vit_stat = 2 or 3.
Last date of follow up if Vit_stat = 1
According to ISO 8601

Variable label/description: Flagging for date for end of follow up
Coding:
0 = exact date for end of follow up
1 = set date for end of follow up

According to relevant version of ICD
Blank/R99 = Unknown/missing

Variable label/description: ICD-edition used for coding cause of death

S = TNM stage, unknown whether clinical or pathological

paS = Pathological TNM stage

coS = Condensed TNM stage
esS = Essential TNM stage
T1 = Tier 1 stage for paediatric tumours
T2 = Tier 2 stage for paediatric tumours
8 = Other system

1 = Stage I, FIGO I, localized, localized limited (L), limited, Dukes A
2 = Stage II, FIGO II, localized advanced (A), locally advanced, advanced, direct extension, Dukes B
3 = Stage III, FIGO III, regional (with or without direct extention), R+, N+, Dukes C
4 = Stage IV, FIGO IV, metastatic, distant, M+, Dukes D
9 = Unknown
